description:
As many documentation teams move towards a docs-as-code workflow, most
are turning to static site generators like Jekyll, Sphynx, Hugo, or
GitBook to turn that 'code' into user-facing documentation websites. In
this mini- workshop, you'll get an introduction to the static site
generator landscape, and apply what you learn by publishing your own
site in class. We'll cover:

-  How static site generators work
-  Comparison of popular generators, with guidelines for choosing one
   for your next project
-  Hands-on editing and publishing of your own statically generated
   portfolio website
title: Workshop - Static Site Generators, What, Why and How
